module.p: cuid share is a feminine common noun.

Examples from Gairm –
[...] ’S bha iad ’nan suidhe an sin ag òl uisge-beatha fad na h-oidhch’, na ceathrar aca. An dràsda ’s a rithist shealladh Iain a-mach air an uinneig ris a’ mhuir ’s na h-eileanan. Chitheadh e aig amannan na faoileagan a’ gabhail seachad, ’s chluinneadh e an cuid sgriachail. [...]
[...] And they were sat there drinking whisky all night, the four of them. Now and again John would look out the window at the sea and the islands. He could see at times the gulls going past, and he could hear their screeching. [...] td. 169, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn
